content:
Title: "The Great Debate: Part VII - The Future of Otakudom on Mars"

Act 1:

The story picks up several years after the events of the previous movie. Tragedy strikes again, as the remaining members of the group of friends pass away. The world is left in mourning, as the loss of the pioneers and advocates of otakudom is felt by fans and industry professionals alike.

However, the legacy of the group lives on through their children, who are now grown and have inherited their parents' love and passion for anime and manga. The children decide to come together and honor their parents' memory by preserving and promoting the future of otakudom.

Act 2:

The children of the group face a new and daunting challenge: the impending destruction of Earth. As the planet becomes uninhabitable, the children are forced to flee and find a new home for themselves and for otakudom.

After much discussion and debate, the children decide to settle on Mars. They use the funds and resources left to them by their parents to build a new library and a community center for anime and manga fans on the red planet.

Act 3:

As the children settle into their new home on Mars, they face a series of challenges and obstacles. They must contend with the harsh conditions of the planet, as well as the lack of infrastructure and support for their community.

However, the children are determined and resilient, and they use their knowledge and expertise to overcome these challenges. They establish a thriving and vibrant community of otakudom on Mars, and begin to explore and develop the potential of the planet for the future of anime and manga.

Act 4:

In the end, the children of the group succeed in their mission to preserve and promote the future of otakudom. They establish a thriving and prosperous community on Mars, and become respected and admired leaders in the world of anime and manga.

The legacy of their parents lives on, and the love and passion for anime and manga is passed down to the next generation. The children continue to enjoy and share their love for the medium, while also ensuring that the future of otakudom is bright and promising, even in the face of adversity and change.
